title.narrative: 4.3 IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE AND CAPACITY TO PROVIDE CHILD FRIENDLY AND GENDER SENSITIV

description.narrative: 4.3. Justice/security professionals and social workers have improved knowledge and capacity to provide child friendly and gender- sensitive services to protect children in contact with the justice system, which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents have improved protection from all forms of violence, abuse and exploitation.

participating-org.narrative: KENDRIYIA BAL NYAYA SAMITIKO SACHIW SECRETARIAT OF CENTRAL CHILD JUSTIC COMMITTEE

Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.3. Justice/security professionals and social workers have improved knowledge and capacity to provide child friendly and gender- sensitive services to protect children in contact with the justice system

description.narrative: Administration of Child Justice (Procedure) 2019 enacted enabling the implementation of measures such as diversion and restorative justice including qualification, appointment and terms of service of social worker, child psychologist or child specialist for the first time in Nepal. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of justice and security personnel capacitated on child friendly and gender-sensitive justice for children including diversion and restorative justice.

actual.value: 2019:Provision related to diversion included in the Act Relating to Children 2018

title.narrative: Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems
An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country
